etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 每(每) (měi) = body of water suggested by pronunciation -> sea or ocean
etymology.interpretation: 海(海) (hǎi, "sea; ocean") combines 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") to suggest its relation to water bodies, with 每(每) (měi) providing the phonetic component to shape the pronunciation, effectively communicating the concept of a vast body of water.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢在海边散步(我喜歡在海邊散步)。
examples.english: I enjoy taking walks by the sea.

examples.chinese: 夕阳映照在海面上(夕陽映照在海面上)，波光闪烁(波光閃爍)。
examples.pinyin: Xīyáng yìngzhào zài hǎimiàn shàng, bōguāng shǎnsuò.
examples.english: The setting sun reflects on the sea surface, and the waves sparkle.

examples.chinese: 海风送来凉意(海風送來涼意)，旅人心生惬意(旅人心生愜意)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎifēng sòng lái liángyì, lǚrén xīnshēng qièyì.
examples.english: The sea breeze brings coolness, and the traveler feels content.
